holidays.name: Take Your Pants for a Walk Day
holidays.description: A silly and whimsical day encouraging people to literally take their pants for a walk—wearing pants on your walk isn't new, but this day invites you to step outside and celebrate your trousers as if they're your walking buddies!
holidays.origin: Started by a playful group of office workers looking to break the monotony with some absurd humor and encourage a bit of exercise and laughter.
holidays.funFact: Some participants have taken it literally and fashioned walking ‘pants’ on wheels or stilts to really make their pants ‘walk’!

holidays.name: National Scotch Day
holidays.description: A toast to the rich, smoky, and sometimes peaty spirit of Scotch whisky from Scotland. A day for connoisseurs and curious sippers to enjoy a dram responsibly.
holidays.origin: An informal day begun by whisky lovers and bloggers to celebrate the distinct heritage and craft of Scotch whisky.
holidays.funFact: The spelling of 'whisky' with no 'e' is unique to Scotland, distinguishing it from Irish and American versions spelled 'whiskey'.

holidays.name: Wedding Day (Vietnam)
holidays.description: In Vietnam, July 27 is known as a day for weddings and celebrations of love, marked by unique cultural rituals and dressed-up couples.
holidays.origin: Traditional Vietnamese culture designated certain auspicious days for weddings based on lunar calendars, with July 27 often seen as a lucky date.
holidays.funFact: Vietnamese weddings often include a procession with the groom's family carrying gifts to the bride's home—an elaborate tradition filled with music, drums, and vibrant costumes.

holidays.name: System Administrator Appreciation Day (Observed on last Friday of July, sometimes falls near this date)
holidays.description: A day to thank the unsung heroes who keep our networks running, troubleshoot mysterious errors, and endure the chaos of tech crises without blinking an eye.
holidays.origin: Started by Ted Kekatos in 2000 to recognize the hard work of system administrators and IT professionals worldwide.
holidays.funFact: SysAdmins often receive gifts ranging from coffee and snacks to humorous tech gadgets or stress-relief toys.
